ygData.msgSnippet: Smidgen awoke with a groan. Whoah, who got the license plate of that worker trransporter that hit me. Uhnnn. Oh, my aching head. What hit me?  She looked

Smidgen awoke with a groan. "Whoah, who got the license plate of 
that worker trransporter that hit me. Uhnnn. Oh, my aching head. 
What hit me?"  She looked down in her lap to see tools laying there 
as well as on the console and floor. "Great, of all the rotten luck."
She checked the scanner next to the homing beacon. Nothing showed on 
it. Plus the auxilury power supply was running low. Soon the beacon 
would stop sending it's signal.  She sighed and slowly walked up the 
ship, holding onto chairs, side railing and floor slats to climb 
up.  She made her way to the main entrance hatch and opened the 
door.  The air smelled sweet and fragrant.  Birds chirped and 
butterflies floated on a gentle breeze.  She breathed in deep and 
sighed. "Well, at least there aren't any space pirates around. So 
count my lucky starts and hope it gets better."  She climbed out of 
the door, lost her hold on the rim and tumbled  to the ground.  She 
lay in an undignified heap for a moment and then got up. She looked 
around to make sure no bot saw that.  Feeling certain that she was 
quite alone, she surveyed the damage to her ship. "This pile of 
ruble will never fly again."  She pulled a reading meter from her 
pocket and checked the energon readings. "Hmm, still stable and 
undamaged so far as I can see."  She turned suddenly as she thought 
she heard something out in the forest.  She shrugged her shoulders 
and turned back to the ship."Perhaps it's nothing. Just a wild 
animal or something." Still to be precausios, she reacted for her 
plasma pistal and turned the safety off. "But just to be on the safe 
side....." she muttered to herself.
